results.title: Splash [Italian version]
results.brief_description: A home swimming pool, an accidental drowning, a distraught helpless mother. Such tragedies can be prevented. A poolside seminar demonstrates the dangers and the means of avoiding them, emphasising the need for awareness and the knowledge of basic methods of resuscitation. In Italian language only.

results.title: Splash
results.creator_credit: Ron Howard, Brian Grazer, Buena Vista and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: A romantic comedy fairytale about a most unlikely liaison between a beautiful mermaid (Daryl Hannah) and a New York businessman, Allen Bauer (Tom Hanks). The two first meet when Allen (as a young boy) is rescued from drowning by the lovely mermaid, but it is many years later before the two are reunited on land in New York and our mermaid has transformed into Madison with legs in place of her fishy tail. Madison not only tries to hide her identity from Allen but she also has to keep her legs away from water - or her telltale fin will return. Added to this, Madison has also captured the interest of an obsessed scientist (Eugene Levy). Light-hearted entertainment with great support from John Candy as Allen’s brother Freddie Bauer.

results.title: Spirogyra: structure and life functions
results.brief_description: The unaided eye sees Spirogyra as green masses of slimy intertwining filaments. The microscope reveals detailed cellular structures, including nucleus, cytoplasm, chloroplasts and pyrenoids - the length and diameter of a spirogyra cell, and in a culture we observe growth and sexual reproduction.

results.title: Spiritual voices from the diaries of war: a narration in five episodes
results.creator_credit: Studio Bereg, Aleksandr Burov, Vladimir Fotijev, V.V.S. Roskomkino, Lenfilm, Eskomfilm and Alexander Sokurov
results.brief_description:
Born in 1951 in the Soviet Union, Sokurov has increasingly gained a reputation as the most important of contemporary Russian film artists. An heir to the transcendent cinema of Andrei Tarkovsky, Sokurov’s body of work forms a rich examination of Russian history and culture, imbued with a spiritual and ethical commitment to the European humanist literary tradition.

‘Spiritual Voices’ was shot with video equipment over an 18-month period in which Sokurov accompanied a young army platoon during harsh and dangerous patrols along the battle lines of the USSR’s war with Afghanistan. Absorbing the gestures and emotions of the homesick young soldiers, Sokurov developed a deep understanding of squadron life. Accordingly, ‘Spiritual Voices’ is free of the usual cinematic bombast concerning war: there is no tightly structured dramatic conflict between good and evil, no diverting spectacles, no individual heroism leading the viewer through a fable of personal and national triumph.

The five parts of ‘Spiritual Voices’ were originally intended to be shown as a serial spanning several sessions for television or cinema. But Sokurov has permitted ACMI to install the work with all five channels playing simultaneously. Viewed in this extraordinarily rich configuration, ‘Spiritual Voices’ vividly captures the mysteriously patterned, non-linear experience of war.

As viewers scan the five screens trying to take in all the information that is assailing them, they piece together an appropriately discontinuous impression of war. Even so, as they sit amidst the platoon’s activities, gestures, and flickering glances, it is clarity rather than frustration or confusion that quickly arises. The work’s complexity sustains and exalts, because the aesthetics of Sokurov’s framing, sound design and editing all imbue the installation with an astounding cohesion. Even though the themes are futility, cruelty and incomprehension, the artwork itself is an inspiring insight into the mess that is war.

results.title: Spirits of the forest; Year of the Gagadju
results.creator_credit: Jeremy Hogarth, Ivo Burum, David Parer, Papua New Guinea. Wildlife, Division of and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: Spirits of the forest looks at the Birds of Paradise in Papua New Guinea and the unique relationship they have with the highlanders. The people believe they gain the special qualities of the birds by wearing their feathers in ceremonies. This episode was written by David Attenborough. “Year of the Gagadju” looks at Kakadu as the traditional homeland of the Gagadju tribe. This is an account of how they divide the year into six seasons, reading the changes around them. The Gagadju are determined that their traditional culture will not be lost for future generations. Both programs are narrated by Sandy Gore.

results.title: Spirits of the air, gremlins of the clouds
results.creator_credit: Alex Proyas, Andrew McPhail, Pro-image, MMA Films and Meaningful Eye Contact Film
results.brief_description: Felix Crabtree (Michael Lake) and his sister Betty (Rhys Davis) live in a dust blown shack admist a vast desert. Felix is a wheelchair bound “Dr. Strangelove” character, obsessed with flying, while Betty is paranoid, child-like, living in a world of her own, surrounded by religous relics and obsessed by the past. When a weatherbeaten fugitive named Smith (“The Norm”) staggers towards the homestead and collapses, Felix and Betty revive him. Felix learns that he and Smith share a desire to escape - Smith from his hunters and Felix from the dusty world he is forced to inhabit. They begin to build a flying machine to carry them to a new world but Felix soon realises that it is not just physical difficulties confining them to the desert.

results.title: Spirits of Havana
results.creator_credit: Luis O. Garcia, Bay Weyman, Peter Starr and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: ‘Spirits of Havana’ follows a pair of Canadian jazz players, Jane Bunnett and Larry Cramer, who trek annually to Cuba to collaborate with the local musicians there. Of course, like its recent antecedent, ‘Buena Vista Social Club’, ‘Spirits of Havana’ ends up celebrating the conviviality of Cuban people and culture and the integral role that music and rhythm plays in their lives. Shots of bustling Havana city streets or the bountiful Cuban countryside, overlaid with traditional Cuban music, punctuate this documentary and strongly hint at the Canadians’ love affair with this place. Extended recording sessions with a variety of local musicians from Bobby Carcasses, Amado Dedeu and Pancho Quinto to world famous Afro-Cuban rumba groups like Los Munequitos and Los Naranjos to Desandann, a Haitian group, reveal rich cross-cultural collaboration in action. The Canadians ensure it’s a two-way exchange when they carry out their educational and resource initiative by donating instruments to the local, under-resourced music conservatories and teach the students the world of jazz. Though lacking the cinematic splendour of ‘Buena Vista Social Club’, ‘Spirits of Havana’ is moving for its celebration of Cuban music, culture and history and for its testament to the possibility of cross-cultural understanding and exchange.
